instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165, does not wake up
threads.message: Machine works fine, but when it sleeps, it does not wake up, keyboard backlight comes on, screen does not come on at all, SMC reset and P-RAM reset has been done severally, nothing changed

threads.title: 820-00165, does not wake up
threads.message:
Original Magsafe 2 charger?
Check SMC_LID level.

threads.title: 820-00165, does not wake up
threads.message: It’s 3.4v when the lid is open and 0.00 when the lid is closed

threads.title: 820-00165, does not wake up
threads.message: Remove internal SSD and test with USB macOS.

threads.title: 820-00165, does not wake up
threads.message: usb macOS works fine. the screen comes on immediately

threads.title: 820-00165, does not wake up
threads.message:
Then reinstall macOS on internall SSD.
Save data first, if needed...

threads.title: 820-00165, does not wake up
threads.message: at first the system wasn't completely booting, so i change the SSD, its now completely booting, so i now got this screen not wakening up after sleep, so in a nut shell i just installed bigsur on the ssd, still not waking up installed i now tried  another known good ssd from another system, it will load to 100% progress bar but it wont switch to desktop or home screen, its will stock on 100% progress bar for ever

threads.title: 820-00165, does not wake up
threads.message: Test with older macOS, like Mojave, or Catalina.

threads.title: 820-00165, does not wake up
threads.message:
Usb Catalina macOS wount boot pass the progress bar it will be stucked on 99% progress bar forever.
but BigSur and Monterey will boot to recovery.
Then I notice it takes longer  time for it to chime. 
On Monterey, when it sleeps and I opens the lid, they keyboard light comes up immediately and the display flashes and after 3 seconds  screen will now stay.
Then sometime the screen backlight only will come up for like 5 seconds before the display comes on.
